But the latter is risky, and I would see no reason for the NAEB to

Of course this "10 years" may be amended downward. If so, and if
I stay in, this may change. It has already been changed to 10 frcm
the 15 years it was when I came.
We can discuss this later, of course, but this will answer the
question.
We think, but are not yet officially sure, that the solution above
suggested will be possible. On the basis of what Frank Schooley
has been able to find out, we*11 probably not have to move out of
present quarters, even if only the Network revolving part of our
budget (some $35,000 to $40,000) is left in University hands. I
think we should leave this where it is, in that case, because of
many other considerations I won*t go into at the moment. It would
give us a home, probably at less than we could rent. And meanwhile,
with Headquarters not under the University, we*re already in a
better position to consider next steps.
